result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on October 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

3:37 PM Defendant Lordie Jamaine Cole appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Colin T Nicholson appeared by video for Lordie Jamaine Cole.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander David Goulart appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. $750 signature bond with conditions,  May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional. Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.
